titles.title: Art Thou Weary, Art Thou Languid?

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Art thou weary, art thou languid, At thou sore distressed? "Come to Me," saith One, "and coming, Be at rest."

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Hath He marks to lead me to Him, If He be my Guide? In His feet and hands are wound-prints, And His side."

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Is there diadem, as Monarch, That His brow adorns? Yea, a crown, in very surety, But of thorns.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: If I ask Him to receive me, Will He say me nay? Not till earth and not till heaven Pass away.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Finding, foll'wing, keeping, struggling, Is He sure to bless? Saints, apostles, prophets, martyrs, Answer, "Yes." Amen.
